actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on March 11, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Hill moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Ciscomani asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Friday, March 8, 2024, it adjourn to meet on Monday, March 11, 2024, at noon for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 212
actions-list.actionItem: 205 (Roll no. 78).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 205
actions-list.actionItem: 213 (Roll no. 77).
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Houlahan moved to recommit to the Committee on Financial Services.
The House adopted the amendments en gross as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 2799.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Waters amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 206
actions-list.actionItem: 217 (Roll no. 76).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Lynch amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 208
actions-list.actionItem: 211 (Roll no. 75).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Tlaib amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 204
actions-list.actionItem: 212 (Roll no. 74).

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Houlahan amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 200
actions-list.actionItem: 203 (Roll no. 73).

At the conclusion of debate on the Waters amendment No. 9, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Waters demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1052, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Waters amendment No. 9.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Waters,  numbered 9 printed in Part B of House Report 118-407 to requi re any investment adviser, private fund, or an investment company that is subject to the bill to annually and publicly disclose their investments into women-owned, minority-owned, veteran-owned, rural-domiciled, and other businesses.

At the conclusion of debate on the Lynch amendment No. 8, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Mr. Lynch demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1052, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Lynch amendment No. 8.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Lynch,  numbered 8 printed in Part B of House Report 118-407 to provide that the bill may take effect only when the Securities and Exchange Commission, in consultation with State securities regulators, certifies to Congress that nothing in the bill will increase fraud.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tlaib amendment No. 7, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Tlaib demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1052, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tlaib amendment No. 7.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Tlaib,  numbered 7 printed in Part B of House Report 118-407 to ensure that exemptions or benefits provided by the bill may only apply to companies that do not impose "junk fees" on customers.

At the conclusion of debate on the Houlahan amendment No. 6, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Houlahan demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1052, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Houlahan amendment No. 6.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Houlahan,  numbered 6 printed in Part B of House Report 118-407 to require the Advocate for Small Business Capital Formation to include in its report the effects of the failure of Silicon Valley Bank on community banks and small business lending.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2799 â€” "To make reforms to the capital markets of the United States, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Tonko to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Reverend Sean Raftis, St. Charles Borromeo Church, Whitefish, Montana
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
